result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Bexson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply. To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims or their residence.

Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample- on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CASH BOND CONDITIONS AMENDED
- Defendant shall not be in the City of Stoughton.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Matthew M or any member of his family.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not be outside his residence unless accompanied by a parent or grandparent, except if defendant is working at The Colony Brands, Inc. Fulfillment Center, 1615 Commerce Drive, Sun Prairie, Wisconsin 53590 while Amy Bexson is also working at that location. 
- Defendant shall not be at any McFarland School District schools or school events.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the Def appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 per case. If the Def posts cash bail, the Def must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the Def's release. The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If Def fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $100,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
